page.title: 13ST. MARK'S PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The Church was consecrated on St. Mark's Day l889 by the Bishop of Winchester, the Right Reverend Dr. Harold Browne. It replaced the mission room which too small. The Lord of the Manor of Shere gave the site and Mr. Cubit (later Lord Ashcome) gave Â£1,000. The church is built of local sandstone. There are several beautiful memorial stained glass windows. The wooden font cover, pulpit, reredos and other carvings are the work of local craftsmen. The church is much loved by local people, many of whom have made gifts of furnishings, communion vessels and decorations. This lovely church is in the centre of the village, surrounded by lawns, shrubs and trees. The burial ground is a little further up the hill.
